website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance Fresh Foam Vongo v3 was considered by most to be a reliable option to combat overpronation. Runners were happy with its stability mechanisms, the comfortable underfoot platform, the lightweight build, and the endearing looks. On the other hand, this road companion’s façade was deemed burly, but such a complaint wasn’t deal-breaking.
pros: The stability mechanisms that are present in the New Balance Fresh Foam Vongo v3 were lauded by overpronators
Several consumers considered the underfoot platform to be soft and responsive
Some people felt that this shoe was pleasantly lightweight, considering it’s a stability option
The various color schemes were deemed visually refreshing
Wearing this shoe for long periods didn’t result in fatigue or muscle discomfort, a tester reported
cons: A few people claimed that this running shoe looked bulky

customer_reviews.title: Got about 40 miles in the , probably won't take any further
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff ride. Bought for stability over long runs, but in comparrison to shoes I had been running in these really beat up my feet. Not great transition and overall feel heavy. Not comfortable enough for those long slow efforts, and way too heavy and cumbersome for anything fast.

customer_reviews.title: Overpronation and blister friendly
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, as a larger guy who runs, a lot, I suffered loads with overpronation and blisters on my instep. These have corrected them both and honestly going for a run not having to worry about blisters is so freeing its unreal

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing brooks and got them too fitted. This time I ordered these new balance a whole size bigger than normal shoes and the wider fitting and cushion sole is perfect. Very comfortable would highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: 5 but a size 8 in these was a perfect fit. I'm a heavier runner with a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a pair of Nike Winflo 3's this was a huge upgrade. I am usually a size 7.5 but a size 8 in these was a perfect fit. I'm a heavier runner with a small amount of over pronation. These trainers corrected the over pronation (observed on a gait analysis). Ample room in the toe box and plenty of cushioning. A highly recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Support, Comfort, Low drop
customer_reviews.text: Love them. First impression when wearing: extremely comfy, ... and toes directed upward. These are low drop (4mm) this - turns out - serves me really well as am overpronator, got my calves and ankles stretched properly and am transitioning from 7mm drop shoes. (with short Achilles tendon or limited ankle mobility these might be really bad choice). The low drop nudges you towards midsole/ball striking and higher cadence. For the ample arch support they provide they are springy and light. Very comfy heel cup (got narrow heel), no friction there. And finally they look nice, the 3d mesh looks definitely posh.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. A. Jablonski

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable daily workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Superb shoe that has held up for 800km of daily runs over 3 months. Very comfortable and well cushioned. The standard shoe has a wide toe and so very comfortable. I think i could probably get another 100k out of them but have just ordered the Rubix and Summit Unknown GTX as a replacement. Double up. Hopefully they should be as good.
customer_reviews.author: Avid runner

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam Vongo V3 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: These Fresh Foam Vongo v3 trainers from New Balance feature dual-density rubber outsole material which creates a unique system of stability to help combat over-pronation. Meanwhile, the soft, supportive upper aids in helping to hold the foot securely. The Fresh Foam Vongo v3 for men continues to deliver utmost cushioning and smooth support.
